body.name: Dead Man's Mirror: A Hercule Poirot Story (Hercule Poirot Mysteries)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My husband Loves Agatha Christie books! He has a library full of books and has read them all!The book arrived in great shape and perfect time and also a great value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun and entertaining, easy read with just a smidge of humor here and there
reviews.reviewText: I'm not a fan of short stories, but I just do not have the will power to pass up the opportunity to read, yet again, one of Agatha Christie's books....long or short! I love the humor that the rather pompous little Belgian detective, Hercule Poirot, provides for the reader as he meticulously solves crimes. He is a bit unorthodox in his conclusions and does not give up until he solves his case. In this adventure Poirot receives a note requesting his presence at a time to be later disclosed. Who is this gentleman and why does he need the services of the great and famous Poirot? He is a bit put-off by the order; however, his curiosity takes over when he asks an acquaintance about the writer of the note. He is told the old gent is somewhat egotistical and a bit mad. Well, that piques Poirot's curiosity, and he decides that he will abide by the summons. He arrives at dinner time, but the guests seem quite surprised to have a stranger in their midst. But where is the gentleman who summoned the great little detective to his home? Keep your little gray cells busy and follow along with the great detective and see if you can solve the crime before Poirot. If one is an Agatha Christie fan, then this will be an enjoyable read; however, if one is looking for modern day blood, gore and mutilation scenes this will not measure up to those expectations. I love Ms. Christie's mysteries because they include a bit of suspense, mystery, humor and are just plain fun to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: “Murder in the Mews” is one of my personal favorite Christie short story. Without giving away the solution I will say that this is a great example of misdirection and originality one expects from Christie. “The Incredible Theft” is not on the par with Christie’s best works, but still is an above-average piece. “Dead Man’s Mirror” is basically an expanded rework of her earlier short story “The Second Gong”. “Triangle at Rhodes” is a good example of a terrific short story: exotic location, interesting characters, and a fine prose. That notwithstanding it reads more like a Miss Marple story than a Poirot mystery: the solution involves “this person reminds me of such-and- such criminal from the past” rather than specific clues, and the ending is a bit of a disappointment. I would get this book for the title story which is one of Christie’s finest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Four excellent Poirot novellas from Christie's prime
reviews.reviewText: Here is the opening sentence of one of the four novellas included in this collection: "As the butler handed round the soufflé, Lord Mayfield leaned confidentially toward his neighbour on the right, Lady Julia Carrington." Right away, you know you are in prime Agatha Christie country: The British Empire is at its height and some of the aristocracy have gathered at a country estate where mystery and intrigue are sure to break out. This collection was first published in 1938. My favorite Christie's are from this period from the mid-1920s through the mid-1940s when she was at her best as a writer and before the dreariness of postwar Britain had overcome the Empire, country estates, and the aristocracy.All four of these novellas are quite good; two are even locked-room murders. Overall, I much prefer the Poirot novels to the short stories. The short stories provide insufficient space for much character development or much time for Poirot to fully display his deductive abilities. These novellas, however, are long enough to avoid the shortcomings of the short stories. If you are new to Christie, this collection -- while not quite as good as her best novels -- is not a bad place to start. If you are a Christie fan, then you pretty much know what you are getting.This collection has also been published under the title, "Dead Man's Mirror." These new Harper paperback editions are quite nicely done. They can be read easily without breaking their spines and should hold up to multiple rereadings. Because they retain British spellings, I assume that they follow the text of the original British editions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This is a repackaging of 4 short stories with new cover art. All 4 are in the Hercule Poirot Complete Short Stories collection of 50-which I already had.I got this just after TG, and didn’t realize until last night when “Murder in the Mews” seemed familiar....I normally check for duplicates, but none of the 4, or their descriptions seemed to be familiar, and I had set a goal to read 100 books on my Kindle this year, and needed to keep up my reading supply, so it got it. It’s now too late to get the refund.The stories are fine, I just want you to be aware that they are in the Complete Hercule Poirot Short Stories, and may be in other compilations as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
reviews.reviewText: As usual a great short story by Agatha Christie. Always has complex characters and a setting to match the theme of the story. Fun to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps your interest, and keeps you guessing
reviews.reviewText: I write mysteries. The biggest compliment given to a mystery writer is to say, "I didn't see that coming. "The killer and motive--I didn't see it coming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Anything Agatha Christie has to be good: M. Poirot is very observant and persistent in gathering facts in order to figure it out!Highly recommend this story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A very good Agatha book, always different and always good, I must have read 90% of them now and have found very few not to my liking

reviews.reviewTitle: To see the name - Agatha Christie
reviews.reviewText: I always enjoy Agatha Christie!!!This one was no exception!!
Para mim, não é dos melhores Poirot. Enredo fraco, pistas como que "arranjadas", história pouco convincente. Serve apenas como um passeio pelo estilo do detetive belga.
